objects.name: Open Source Libraries Altered
objects.description: An attacker with access to an open source code project (OSS) and knowledge of its particular use for in a system being developed, manufactured, or supported for the victim, can insert malicious code into the open source software used for math libraries in anticipation of inclusion into the system for the purpose of disruption or further compromise within the victim organization.

external_references.description: John F. Miller, Supply Chain Attack Framework and Attack Patterns, 2013, The MITRE Corporation

x_capec_example_instances: An attacker with access to an open source code project introduces a hard-to-find bug in the software that allows under very specific conditions for encryption to be disabled on data streams. The attacker commits the change to the code which is picked up by a manufacturer who develops VPN software. It is eventually deployed at the victim's location where the very specific conditions are met, and the attacker is able to sniff plaintext traffic thought to be encrypted, allowing the attacker to gain access to sensitive data of the victim.
x_capec_prerequisites: Access to the open source code base being used by the manufacturer in a system being developed or currently deployed at a victim location.

x_capec_skills_required.High: Advanced knowledge about the inclusion and specific usage of an open source code project within system being targeted for infiltration.
